title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.20 part 3 | 24-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chakshurunmeelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Itinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pachatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Devim Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Raye
In this session, we will continue to discuss from the 20th verse of the 16th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
We already have discussed this verse in two previous sessions.
So, this is part 3 of the same verse.
The 3rd session will be discussing the remaining portion of the purport because it is a very big purport.
Just to refresh your memory, this 20th verse,
I have lost my three legs and I am now standing on one only.
Are you lamenting for my state of existence?
Or are you in great anxiety because henceforward the unlawful meat eaters will exploit you?
Or are you in a sorry plight because the demigods are now bereft of their share of sacrificial life?
Or are you in a sorry plight because the demigods are now bereft of their share of sacrificial life?
Or are you in a sorry plight because the demigods are now bereft of their share of sacrificial life?
Because no sacrifices are being performed at present?
Or are you grieving for living beings because of their sufferings due to famine and drought?
These are the various questions raised by Dharma in the form of a bull to Mother Earth in the form of a cow.
So, this is actually describing this.
the symptoms of the Kali Yuga. Of course, the Dharma in the form of a bull, the symbolic
representation of Dharma in the form of a bull. And Mother Earth symbolically represented by the
cow, form of a cow, shape of a cow. So, Srila Prabhupada describes these things in the purport
in a great detail. So, we'll continue where we left off in the previous session.

of Godhead. Actually, Bhakti means 100% firm faith in

Actually, Bhakti means 100% firm faith in the Supreme Personality of Godhead. And Bhakti means

there is a difference. What's the difference? Now, blind faith,
is not having the foundation of proper knowledge. Proper facts is not having the foundation of

is based on reality, is based on knowledge, is based on knowledge, is based on reality,
is based on truth and facts. For example, if I have not seen, let us say, I have not seen China,
I never been to China, I never seen China, the country called China. But then, my faith that
there is a correct knowledge, there is a correct knowledge, there is a correct knowledge, there is

like we grow. So, this faith,

even though I have not seen it, I have not actually visited that place. I can visit if I want to,

Intelligence every moment as we use the intelligence. Krishna is our eternal, we are eternally related to Krishna. As spirit soul we are eternal beings. Krishna as a supreme spirit is eternal lord and we have an eternal relationship.

So, these are all facts, hard facts. These are cent percent truth. This is reality. Not because I am just saying it in a very very forceful way. No, it is actually based on shastra, authorized shastra. It is based on the acharyas.
See Prabhupada travelled all over the world and preached.
And actually convinced and made people realize through the authentic process of Krishna consciousness.
Anybody who practices Krishna consciousness by receiving that knowledge and the proper instructions from the proper source.
They can become convinced, they can become, they can develop the firm faith.
They can awaken their knowledge.
Their heart can undergo transformation.
By which doubts are eradicated permanently.
It is not that somebody has got doubt and somehow by some argument or logic or some kind of feeling their doubts are gone.
But again something else happens by which again the doubt comes back.
But again something else happens by which again the doubt comes back.
But again something else happens by which again the doubt comes back.
But again something else happens by which again the doubt comes back.
You see.
Not that kind of eradication of doubt.
Some temporary mitigation of the doubt.
No.
This change of heart by which doubts are eradicated is due to the purification of the heart.
By the authorized spiritual process.
So therefore when Prabhupada says there are gradations of human beings in terms of proportionate faith in the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
What he means is the real faith.
The transcendental faith.
That's the correct word.
The transcendental faith.
Which is nothing to do with material sentiments.
Material beliefs.
Material knowledge.
Material experience.
Material relationships.
Nothing to do with any of those.
It is completely different.
So this is explained by Prabhupada here.
As first class faithful men are the Vaishnavas and the Brahmanas.
Qualified ones.
The second class faith.
Are those qualified Kshatriyas.
The third class faith are those for qualified Vaishyas.
And the fourth class faith are the qualified Shudras.
So this is the proportionate faith in the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
In the gradations of human beings in the Varnashrama society.
So I'll stop here.
We'll continue this in the next section.
Next session.

At the end of life when we have to quit this body.
Yamadutas will come and take us to hell.
If we have been very very sinful.
And we are not atoned for these sinful activities.
So chanting Hare Krishna is the best way of atoning for all sinful activities.
And of course stopping meat eating, intoxication, gambling and illicit sex.
We can be saved from going to hell.
I'll stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
